question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 1 Most lymphatics of the breast drain into which lymph nodes?
explanation: The majority of lymph from the breast drains into the axillary lymph nodes, making them crucial in breast cancer metastasis.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 2 The esophagus passes through the diaphragm at the level of which vertebra?
explanation: The esophagus passes through the esophageal hiatus of the diaphragm at the level of T10.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 3 The bifurcation of the trachea is at the level of …
options: Intervertebral disc between T4 and T5
answerText: Intervertebral disc between T4 and T5
explanation: The trachea bifurcates into the left and right bronchi at the level of the intervertebral disc between T4 and T5, corresponding to the sternal angle.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 4 Which costal cartilage is articulated to the sternal angle?
explanation: The second costal cartilage articulates with the sternum at the sternal angle, a key anatomical landmark.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 5 The external intercostal muscle in the anterior part of the intercostal space changes to the …
explanation: The external intercostal muscles terminate anteriorly and continue as the external intercostal membrane.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 6 The breast is innervated by which nerves?
explanation: The breast is innervated by anterior and lateral cutaneous branches of the intercostal nerves T2-T6.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 7 Which muscle is located only in the middle two-fourths of the intercostal spaces?
explanation: The innermost intercostal muscles are only found in the middle portions of the intercostal spaces.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 8 Where is the location of the coronary sinus?
options: Inferior surface of the heart between the left atrium and left ventricle
Near the apex of the heart
answerText: Inferior surface of the heart between the left atrium and left ventricle
explanation: The coronary sinus is located on the inferior surface of the heart, draining deoxygenated blood into the right atrium.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 9 Which structure is located on the superior part of the crista terminalis, lateral to the opening of the superior vena cava?
explanation: The sinoatrial node, the primary pacemaker of the heart, is situated in this location.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 10 Where is the location of the moderator band?
explanation: The moderator band is a muscular bundle in the right ventricle that carries part of the right bundle branch of the conduction system.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 11 The anterior interventricular artery is a branch of …
explanation: The anterior interventricular artery (also known as the left anterior descending artery) is a major branch of the left coronary artery.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 12 The posterior intercostal artery of the second intercostal space is formed by …
explanation: The supreme intercostal artery, a branch of the costocervical trunk, supplies the first two intercostal spaces.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 13 The anterior intercostal artery in the 9th intercostal space is a branch of which artery?
explanation: The musculophrenic artery, a terminal branch of the internal thoracic artery, supplies the lower intercostal spaces.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 14 The superior intercostal vein on the right side drains into which vein?
explanation: The right superior intercostal vein drains into the arch of the azygos vein, which then drains into the superior vena cava.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 15 Where is the location of the bifurcation of the internal thoracic artery?
explanation: The internal thoracic artery bifurcates into the musculophrenic and superior epigastric arteries at the 6th intercostal space.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 16 Where is the location of Haller’s oblique sinus?
options: Between the left atrium and esophagus
Between the right atrium and pulmonary trunk
Between the aorta and pulmonary artery
Between the left ventricle and diaphragm
answerText: Between the left atrium and esophagus
explanation: Haller’s oblique sinus is a pericardial space located posterior to the left atrium and anterior to the esophagus.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 17 Which one is located in the superior and anterior mediastinum?
explanation: The thymus is located in the superior and anterior mediastinum, primarily in children and young adults.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 18 Which one is located in the superior and posterior mediastinum?
explanation: The esophagus is part of the superior and posterior mediastinum, descending toward the diaphragm.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 19 Where is the bifurcation of the brachiocephalic trunk?
options: Posterior to the left sternoclavicular joint
Posterior to the right sternoclavicular joint
At the level of the aortic arch
answerText: Posterior to the right sternoclavicular joint
explanation: The brachiocephalic trunk bifurcates into the right subclavian and right common carotid arteries posterior to the right sternoclavicular joint.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 20 Which structure is located anterior to the 3 main branches of the arch of the aorta?
explanation: The left brachiocephalic vein crosses anteriorly over the branches of the aortic arch.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 21 Four inferior left posterior intercostal veins drain into the …
explanation: The hemiazygos vein collects blood from the lower left posterior intercostal veins and drains into the azygos vein.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 22 The left superior intercostal vein drains into the …
explanation: The left superior intercostal vein drains directly into the left brachiocephalic vein.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 23 Where is the location of the thoracic duct in the posterior mediastinum?
explanation: The thoracic duct ascends through the posterior mediastinum, positioned posterior to the esophagus.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 24 Which vertebrae have long and oblique spinous processes?
explanation: Thoracic vertebrae have long, downward-sloping spinous processes, distinguishing them from cervical and lumbar vertebrae.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 25 Which vertebrae have large bodies and triangular vertebral foramina?
explanation: Lumbar vertebrae have large bodies to support the weight of the upper body and triangular vertebral foramina.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 26 The central gelatinous part of the intervertebral disc is called …
explanation: The nucleus pulposus is the soft, gelatinous core of the intervertebral disc that helps absorb shock and allows flexibility.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 27 Increasing of the anterior convexity of the lumbar part of the vertebral column is named …
explanation: Lordosis refers to the inward curvature of the lumbar spine, increasing its anterior convexity.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 28 Which nerve passes posterior to the pulmonary root?
explanation: The vagus nerve passes posterior to the pulmonary root, while the phrenic nerve passes anteriorly.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 29 Which muscle is covered by the clavipectoral fascia?
explanation: The clavipectoral fascia encloses the pectoralis minor and subclavius muscles.

question: Second Batch (2024-6-22) Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 30 The serratus anterior muscle is innervated by …
explanation: The long thoracic nerve innervates the serratus anterior, which is essential for scapular protraction and stabilization.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 1 Which one is located in the anterior mediastinum?
explanation: The thymus is located in the anterior mediastinum, while the trachea and esophagus are found in the superior and posterior mediastinum, respectively.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 2 Where is location of apex of the heart?
explanation: The apex of the heart is located at the left 5th intercostal space, typically near the midclavicular line.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 3 Which one is located on the lateral wall of the right atrium?
explanation: The crista terminalis is a muscular ridge on the lateral wall of the right atrium, marking the boundary between the smooth and rough parts.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 4 Where is location of moderator band or septomarginal trabecula?
explanation: The moderator band is a muscular structure found in the right ventricle, extending from the interventricular septum to the anterior papillary muscle.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 5 Apex of the heart is formed by:
explanation: The apex of the heart is primarily formed by the left ventricle.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 6 Where is location of coronary sinus?
options: Between left atrium and left ventricle
Between right atrium and right ventricle
answerText: Between left atrium and left ventricle
explanation: The coronary sinus is located posteriorly between the left atrium and the left ventricle, draining venous blood from the heart.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 7 Which one is located in the bottom of the right atrium near septum?
explanation: The AV node is situated at the bottom of the right atrium near the septum, crucial for electrical conduction.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 8 7th anterior intercostal artery is a branch of the:
explanation: The 7th anterior intercostal artery arises from the musculophrenic artery, a branch of the internal thoracic artery.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 9 Lateral cutaneous branch of which intercostal nerve contributes in innervation of medial surface of the arm?
explanation: The lateral cutaneous branch of the second intercostal nerve (T2), also called the intercostobrachial nerve, innervates the medial surface of the arm.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 10 Which part of the rib is articulated to articular facet of the transverse process of thoracic vertebra?
explanation: The tubercle of the rib articulates with the transverse process of the corresponding thoracic vertebra.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 11 Scalene tubercle is a tubercle on the superior surface of:
explanation: The scalene tubercle is a bony prominence on the first rib where the anterior scalene muscle attaches.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 12 In the anatomical position, jugular notch is at the level of which vertebra?
explanation: The jugular notch is located at the level of the T2 vertebra in the anatomical position.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 13 Base of the breast vertically extends from … rib to … rib.
explanation: The base of the breast extends vertically from the second to the sixth ribs.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 14 Nipple of the breast is innervated by:
explanation: The nipple is innervated by the 4th intercostal nerve.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 15 Serratus anterior muscle is innervated by:
explanation: The serratus anterior muscle is supplied by the long thoracic nerve, which arises from C5, C6, and C7.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 16 Anterior interventricular artery is a branch of:
explanation: The anterior interventricular artery is a branch of the left coronary artery, also known as the left anterior descending artery (LAD).

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 17 Which one passes through diaphragm at the level of T8?
explanation: The inferior vena cava passes through the diaphragm at the level of T8.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 18 Which one is insertion of the pectoralis minor muscle?
explanation: The pectoralis minor muscle inserts on the coracoid process of the scapula.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 19 Which one has pectinate muscles?
options: Posterior part of the right atrium
explanation: Pectinate muscles are present in the left auricle and the right atrium.

question: First Batch (2024-06-22) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 20 Sternal angle is at the level of:
options: Intervertebral disc between T4 and T5
answerText: Intervertebral disc between T4 and T5
explanation: The sternal angle is at the level of the intervertebral disc between T4 and T5, an important anatomical landmark.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 1 Which muscle is covered by clavipectoral fascia?
explanation: The clavipectoral fascia covers the pectoralis minor muscle.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 2 Serratus anterior muscle is innervated by ….
explanation: The serratus anterior muscle is supplied by the long thoracic nerve.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 3 Most lymphatics of the breast drain into which lymph nodes?
explanation: The majority of lymph from the breast drains into the axillary lymph nodes.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 4 Esophagus passes through the diaphragm at the level of which vertebra?
explanation: The esophagus passes through the diaphragm at the level of T10.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 5 Bifurcation of the trachea is at the level of ….
options: Intervertebral disc between T4 and T5
answerText: Intervertebral disc between T4 and T5
explanation: The trachea bifurcates at the level of the intervertebral disc between T4 and T5.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 6 Which costal cartilage is articulated to the sternal angle?
explanation: The second costal cartilage articulates with the sternal angle.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 7 External intercostal muscle in the anterior part of the intercostal space changes to the …
explanation: The external intercostal muscle becomes the external intercostal membrane anteriorly.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 8 The breast is innervated by which nerves?
explanation: The breast is supplied by the anterior and lateral cutaneous branches of intercostal nerves T2-T6.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 9 Which muscle is located only in the middle two fourths of the intercostal spaces?
explanation: The innermost intercostal muscle is present only in the middle two-fourths of the intercostal spaces.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 10 Where is the location of the coronary sinus?
options: Inferior surface of the heart between left atrium and left ventricle
Posterior surface of the right atrium
answerText: Inferior surface of the heart between left atrium and left ventricle
explanation: The coronary sinus is located on the inferior surface of the heart between the left atrium and left ventricle.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 11 Which structure is located on the superior part of the crista terminalis, lateral to the opening of the superior vena cava?
explanation: The sinoatrial node is located at the superior end of the crista terminalis near the opening of the superior vena cava.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 12 Where is the location of the moderator band?
explanation: The moderator band is a muscular band of heart tissue found in the right ventricle.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 13 Anterior interventricular artery is a branch of ….
explanation: The anterior interventricular artery (also called the left anterior descending artery) is a branch of the left coronary artery.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 14 Posterior intercostal artery of the second intercostal space is formed by ….
explanation: The posterior intercostal arteries of the first and second intercostal spaces arise from the supreme intercostal artery.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 15 Anterior intercostal artery in the 9th intercostal space is a branch of which artery?
explanation: The anterior intercostal arteries of the lower spaces, including the 9th, arise from the musculophrenic artery.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 16 Superior intercostal vein on the right side drains into which vein?
explanation: The superior intercostal vein on the right side drains into the arch of the azygos vein.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 17 Where is the location of bifurcation of the internal thoracic artery?
explanation: The internal thoracic artery bifurcates at the level of the 6th intercostal space.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 18 Where is the location of the Haller’s oblique sinus?
explanation: Haller’s oblique sinus is a pericardial recess located between the left atrium and the esophagus.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 19 Which one is located in the superior and anterior mediastinum?
explanation: The thymus is located in the superior and anterior mediastinum.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 20 Which one is located in the superior and posterior mediastinum?
explanation: The esophagus is located in the superior and posterior mediastinum.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 21 Where is the bifurcation of the brachiocephalic trunk?
options: Posterior to the left sternoclavicular joint
Posterior to the right sternoclavicular joint
answerText: Posterior to the right sternoclavicular joint
explanation: The brachiocephalic trunk bifurcates posterior to the right sternoclavicular joint.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 22 Which structure is located anterior to the 3 main branches of the arch of aorta?
explanation: The left brachiocephalic vein crosses anterior to the branches of the arch of the aorta.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 23 Which nerve passes posterior to the pulmonary root?
explanation: The vagus nerve passes posterior to the pulmonary root.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 24 Four inferior left posterior intercostal veins drain into the …
explanation: The four inferior left posterior intercostal veins drain into the hemiazygos vein.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 25 Left superior intercostal vein drains into the ….
explanation: The left superior intercostal vein drains into the left brachiocephalic vein.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 26 Where is the location of the thoracic duct in the posterior mediastinum?
explanation: The thoracic duct lies posterior to the esophagus in the posterior mediastinum.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 27 Which vertebrae have long and oblique spinous processes?
explanation: Thoracic vertebrae have long and oblique spinous processes.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 28 Which vertebrae have large bodies and triangular vertebral foramen?
explanation: Lumbar vertebrae have large bodies and triangular vertebral foramina.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 29 Central gelatinous part of the intervertebral disc is called …
explanation: The central gelatinous part of the intervertebral disc is called the nucleus pulposus.

question: First and Second Batch (2024-09-23) Retake Exam - Dr. Hasanzadeh - Question 30 Increasing of the anterior convexity of the lumbar part of the vertebral column is named …
explanation: An increase in the anterior convexity of the lumbar spine is called lordosis.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 1 Where is location of the sinoatrial node?
options: Superior part of the crista terminalis
Inferior part of the crista terminalis
Medial wall of the right atrium
Medial wall of the left atrium
answerText: Superior part of the crista terminalis
explanation: The sinoatrial (SA) node is located at the superior part of the crista terminalis near the opening of the superior vena cava in the right atrium.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 2 Where is location of septomarginal (Moderator) band?
explanation: The septomarginal (moderator) band is found in the right ventricle, extending from the interventricular septum to the anterior papillary muscle.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 3 Where is location of the oblique (Marshal) vein?
options: Posterior surface of the right atrium
Posterior surface of the left atrium
Between left atrium and left ventricle
answerText: Posterior surface of the left atrium
explanation: The oblique vein of Marshall runs on the posterior surface of the left atrium and drains into the coronary sinus.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 4 Which nerve has relationship with posterolateral surface of the superior vena cava?
explanation: The right phrenic nerve descends along the right side of the superior vena cava and pericardium, reaching the diaphragm.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 5 Which structure is located in the superior and posterior mediastinum?
explanation: The esophagus passes through both the superior and posterior mediastinum as it descends to the diaphragm.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 6 Where is location of the thoracic duct?
explanation: The thoracic duct lies in the posterior mediastinum, ascending through the superior mediastinum to drain into the venous system at the junction of the left subclavian and internal jugular veins.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 7 Which one is a main characteristic of the thoracic vertebrae?
options: Long spinous process and foramen transversarium
Articular facet on the lateral surface of body
answerText: Articular facet on the lateral surface of body
explanation: Thoracic vertebrae have costal facets on the lateral aspects of their bodies for articulation with ribs.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 8 Where is location of the apex of the heart?
options: 5th right intercostal space, 8 to 10 cm from midline
4th right intercostal space, 8 to 10 cm from midline
5th left intercostal space, 8 to 10 cm from midline
4th left intercostal space, 8 to 10 cm from midline
answerText: 5th left intercostal space, 8 to 10 cm from midline
explanation: The apex of the heart is located in the 5th left intercostal space, approximately 8–10 cm from the midline at the midclavicular line.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 9 Which one is between pulmonary artery and aorta?
explanation: The ligamentum arteriosum connects the pulmonary artery to the aortic arch and is the remnant of the ductus arteriosus.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 10 First posterior intercostal artery is a branch of the ….
explanation: The first and second posterior intercostal arteries arise from the supreme (highest) intercostal artery, a branch of the costocervical trunk.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 11 Which muscle is innervated by the long thoracic nerve?
explanation: The long thoracic nerve supplies the serratus anterior muscle, which helps in scapular protraction and stabilization.

question: Third Batch - 2025 - Dr. Hassanzadeh -- Question 12 In most people SA node and AV node are supplied by ….
explanation: The right coronary artery supplies both the sinoatrial and atrioventricular nodes in the majority of individuals.
